post: Are you a Federal employee or retiree? Then GIVE HAPPY to the Bill of Rights Institute through the Combined Federal Campaign using charity code 36265. One of the great benefits of the CFC is that you can give through payroll deduction or through your retiree annuity, giving a little each pay period and supporting BRI's mission all year long. Visit  https://givecfc.org/ and use code 36265.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CFC

Its easy to GIVE HAPPY by donating a little from each paycheck or pledging a few volunteer hours a month at GiveCFC.org. The online giving system allows you to easily renew your pledge each year and offers the full range of options: Payroll deduction (the most popular!), Credit/debit card, E-check/bank transfer, and Volunteer hours (Federal employees only). Other options include paper pledge forms, the CFC Giving Mobile App, and Text-to-Donate. Learn more at U. S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM)‘s GiveCFC.org.  #GiveCFC

What happens when we deprioritize civics in American schools – and what is it going to take to drive meaningful change? These are some of the questions Bill of Rights Institute President and CEO David Bobb tackles in his latest op-ed, "Do they even teach civics anymore?" Civic education provides students the unique opportunity to understand how our nation and communities function and their roles in civil society,  he writes. All students deserve this knowledge, not just some students.  Read more here,  https://lnkd.in/gR7jqQz4  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civiceducation

The National Civics Teacher of the Year Award was presented to Shari Conditt by representatives from the Bill of Rights Institute and SmartPass at a surprise school assembly on September 10. SmartPass, a leading provider of digital hall pass technology used by thousands of schools nationwide to increase student accountability and foster better outcomes, has joined the Bill of Rights Institute to help sponsor this years contest and awards. Peter Luba, CEO of SmartPass, discusses his company's sponsorship of BRI's National Civics Teacher of the Year Award. Watch the video here  https://lnkd.in/eAR4FkW3.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsTeacheroftheYear

The 2024-2025 MyImpact Challenge is now open for submissions! MyImpact Challenge is a civic engagement contest that incentivizes students to become active in their communities. Recently, Rachel Humphries, BRI's Senior Director, Civic Learning Intitiaitves, spoke with Dave the Scholarship Coach, about the the contest. Listen to the podcast here  https://lnkd.in/eKG5g45j Scholarship GPS (  https://lnkd.in/eGYfPTWD), a sponsor of the 2024-2025 MyImpact Challenge, is dedicated to educating students and families on how to obtain a college degree without student loan debt. Scholarship GPS offers courses and coaching to guide students and parents through the process of finding the best scholarships and provides tips, tools, and strategies for creating winning applications.  #scholarshipopportunities  #billofrightsinstitute  #civicengagement

Constitution Day is today  and the Bill of Rights Institute featured a star-studded lineup for its annual Constitution Day Live! educational programming. This years theme is Built for This: Debate, Dialogue, & the Constitution.  BRI staff explored how our Constitutional system helps us navigate the disagreements that naturally emerge in a free society. With interviews with Condoleeza Rice, former U. S. Secretary of State and now the director of the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, Jane Kamensky, president and CEO of Monticello, Eric Meyer, editor and publisher of the Marion County Record, and author and scholar Yuval Levin, you wont want to miss it!  https://lnkd.in/ebkF728B  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #ConstitutionDayLive

Recently, retired Army Major Gerald Gangaram joined Larry Zilliox, host of Welcome Home: A Podcast for Veterans, About Veterans, By Veterans. In the episode, From Troubled Youth to Apache Pilot: Gerald Gangaram on Military Leadership, Mentorship, and Civic Education,  Gangaram discusses his distinguished career in the Army and his current mission with the Bill of Rights Institute. Gangaram's work with BRI underscores the importance of civic education and fostering better citizenship among future generations.
